name: PostgreSQL Export Plugin
description: Export PostHog events to a PostgreSQL instance on ingestion.

config.markdown: Read [the documentation](https://github.com/PostHog/postgres-plugin) here for instructions in getting these keys.

config.name: Is your PostgreSQL instance hosted on Heroku?
config.hint: This is necessary for appropriately configuring the database connection.

config.name: PostgreSQL Database URL
config.hint: You can use a URL containing host, port, username, and password, or fill in these fields individually below.

config.name: PostgreSQL instance host
config.hint: Example: `postgres.mydomain.com` (Required if Database URL is not specified)

config.name: PostgreSQL instance port
config.hint: Default: 5439 (Required if Database URL is not specified)

config.name: Database name
config.hint: Required if Database URL is not specified

config.name: Table name
config.hint: The plugin will create a table with this name to store the events in

config.name: Username available to the plugin for accessing your database instance
config.hint: This user needs table creation access (Required if Database URL is not specified)

config.name: Password for the username specified above
config.hint: Required if Database URL is not specified

config.name: Upload at most every X seconds
config.hint: If there are events to upload and this many seconds has passed since the last upload, send the events to Redshift. The value must be between 1 and 60 minutes.

config.name: Maximum upload size in megabytes
config.hint: Always keep the uploaded files below this size limit, uploading more frequently than the time limit if needed. Events are kept in memory until then, so make sure your server has enough of it. The value must be between 1 and 10 MB.

config.name: Events to ignore
config.hint: Comma separated list of events to ignore
